sentences.text: The '''2025 IHF World Men's Handball Championship''' was the 29th such event hosted by the International Handball Federation. It was held in Croatia, Denmark and Norway from 14 January to 2 February 2025. This edition marked the first time the IHF World Men's Handball Championship|world championship was held in three countries.

references.text: <ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.ihf.info/media-center/news/ihf-council-awards-events-2027|title=IHF Council awards events up to 2027|date=28 February 2020|work=IHF}}</ref>

sentences.text: Co-host Denmark men's national handball team|Denmark were the triple defending champions, having won the 2019 World Men's Handball Championship|2019, 2021 World Men's Handball Championship|2021 and 2023 World Men's Handball Championship|2023 editions, and successfully defended their title by defeating co-host Croatia men's national handball team|Croatia 32–26 in the final. In doing so, Denmark became the first men's national handball team to win four consecutive world titles. France men's national handball team|France beat Portugal men's national handball team|Portugal to win the bronze medals, while third co-host Norway men's national handball team|Norway finished 10th.

references.text: <ref name=records>{{cite news|url=https://sport.tv2.dk/haandbold/2025-02-01-her-er-danmarks-utrolige-rekorder|publisher=TV2 Danmark|title=Her er Danmarks utrolige rekorder|author=Christian Ipsen|date=2 February 2025|access-date=22 February 2025|language=da|trans-title=Here are Denmark's unbelievable records}}</ref>

sentences.text: On 11 October 2018, five nations expressed interest in hosting the tournament.

references.text: <ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.ihf.info/node/6983|title=Bidders for upcoming IHF events|website=IHF|date=11 October 2018}}</ref>

sentences.text: The deadline elapsed on 25 September 2019. Switzerland became a solo bid, while Croatia took their place in the triple bid. Serbia withdrew their bid, while Hungary filed both an application and deferment for a later tournament. These were the applicants:

references.text: <ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.ihf.info/node/10057|title=2025 and 2027 Men's and Women's World Championships|website=IHF|date=25 September 2019}}</ref>

<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://jyllands-posten.dk/sport/ECE11628056/danmark-har-fundet-ny-makker-i-jagten-paa-at-faa-vm-paa-hjemmebane/|title=Danmark har fundet ny makker i jagten på at få VM på hjemmebane|first=Kenneth|last=Thygesen|date=20 September 2019|website=Jyllands-Posten}}</ref>

<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.24sata.hr/sport/sp-opet-u-hrvatskoj-pridruzili-smo-se-dancima-i-norvezanima-649858|title=SP opet u Hrvatskoj? Pridružili smo se Dancima i Norvežanima|date=21 September 2019|work=24 sata|language=hr}}</ref>

<ref>{{Cite web |last= |date=2020-01-20 |title=Hrvatska, Danska i Norveška zajednički kandidati za SP u rukometu 2025. |url=https://radio1.hr/hrvatska-danska-i-norveska-zajednicki-kandidati-za-sp-u-rukometu-2025/ |access-date=2024-01-30 |work=Radio 1 |language=hr}}</ref>

sentences.text: Shortly before the vote, Hungary and Switzerland both withdrew, leaving the bid of Croatia, Denmark and Norway unopposed.  Croatia, Denmark and Norway were chosen as the hosts on 28 February 2020 at the IHF Council meeting in Cairo, Egypt. This edition marks the first time Norway hosts the World Men's Handball Championship, the second for Croatia, and the third for Denmark.

sentences.text: The bid contained 11 cities: Zagreb, Split, Croatia|Split, Varaždin, Poreč and Dubrovnik in Croatia; Copenhagen and Herning in Denmark; and Trondheim, Stavanger, Drammen and Bærum in Norway; with the opening match and final taking place in Bærum.

sentences.text: On 25 January 2024, Denmark announced that the Jyske Bank Boxen would be their only venue for the competition.

references.text: <ref name=danskhåndbold/> Then, two days later, Norway announced the Unity Arena|Telenor Arena would be their only venue for the tournament, after negotiations with Trondheim fell through due to financial reasons.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.handball.no/nyheter/2024/01/telenor-arena-blir-norsk-vm-arena-i-2025/|title=Telenor Arena blir norsk VM-arena i 2025|website=Norges Håndballforbund|date=27 January 2024}}</ref>

sentences.text:
On 8 April 2024, the International Handball Federation|IHF announced the venues, with Bærum, Herning, Zagreb, Varaždin and Poreč. being confirmed as hosts cities. The opening game will be in Herning and the final will be in Bærum. During the preparations for the tournament, the Unity Arena|Telenor Arena was renamed the Unity Arena for the tournament.

references.text: <ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.ihf.info/media-center/news/estonia-lithuania-italy-and-slovakia-progress-european-qualification-2025-ihf|title=Estonia, Lithuania, Italy and Slovakia progress in the European Qualification for the 2025 IHF Men's World Championship|website=IHF|date=19 March 2024}}</ref>

sentences.text: As the host country of the 2028 Summer Olympics, the first wildcard was given to United States men's national handball team|United States on 18 October 2018. Regarding the second wildcard, 12 non-classificated nations reportedly applied. On 23 May 2024, it was announced that the second wildcard was gived to Switzerland due to multiple reasons: their sporting merit, their commercial reach, their sporting project and also due to the fact that the proposal made by the Swiss broadcast partner was the most commercially interesting for the IHF. Prior to their selection, Switzerland men's national handball team|Switzerland's coach, Andy Schmid, stated that after their narrow penalty shootout loss to Slovenia men's national handball team|Slovenia, the Swiss' performance merited a wildcard.

in Zagreb hosted the draw.|250px|right]]
The draw took place at 19:30 Central European Time|CET in Zagreb, Croatia on 29 May 2024 at the Vatroslav Lisinski Concert Hall. Originally scheduled for the 1 June, it was changed a few weeks later to 29 May.

sentences.text: Ahead of the draw, the 32 finalist teams were seeded into four pots according to IHF rankings in May 2024.

references.text: <ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.ihf.info/sites/default/files/2021-01/Regulations%20for%20IHF%20Competitions_E_4.pdf|title=V. Regulations for IHF Competitions (Indoor Handball)|publisher=International Handball Federation|date=9 December 2020|accessdate=1 January 2022}}</ref>

<ref name="auto3"/> Although, in regards to the European teams in pots 1 and 2, the 2024 European Men's Handball Championship|2024 European Championship decided the teams' positions. In addition, five teams were pre-assigned by the three host nations into each of the available vacant groups: Germany in Group A, Austria in Group C, Hungary in Group D, Sweden in Group F and Slovenia in Group G.<ref name="auto3"/><ref>{{cite news |title=Македонија ќе оди во ждрепка за СП 2025 |url=https://www.g-sport.mk/vest-statija/110278/makedonija-kje-odi-vo-zhdrepka-za-sp-2025/ |work=G-Sport |date=21 May 2024}}</ref>

sentences.text: Croatian host city, Varaždin signed their hosting contract on 26 June 2024. In November 2024, host city Poreč also signed their contract. In December 2024, Croatian Handball Federation, Varaždin County, Međimurje County and Čakovec signed a joint co-hosting contract.

sentences.text: The first phase of ticket sales started on 15 March 2024 in Croatia, while the sales started on 8 April 2024 in Denmark for people who made a federation account.<ref name="auto2"/> General sales in Denmark commenced on  12 April 2024. Norway started their ticket sales on 12 April 2024.<ref name="auto"/>
